description: Yersinia pestis is a Gram-negative non-motile, rod-shaped, coccobacillus bacterium in the family of Enterobacteriaceae. The genus Yersinia contains two other pathogenic species, Y. enterocolitica and Y. pseudotuberculosis. Y. pestis is a facultative anaerobic organism that can infect humans via the Oriental rat flea (Xenopsylla cheopis). It is the cause of bubonic, septicemic, and pneumonic plague.
name: Yersinia pestis Antibodies and Antigens
